member.name: T:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.SequenceFileDisplayReasons
member.summary: These values are passed as a parameter to the ApplicationMgr.DisplaySequenceFile event to provide the reason for why the event was generated.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.SequenceFileDisplayReasons.SequenceFileDisplayReason_UIMessage
member.summary: (Value: 0) The event was generated because the TestStand Engine sent the UIMsg_OpenWindows message for the sequence file.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.SequenceFileDisplayReasons.SequenceFileDisplayReason_OpenSequenceFile
member.summary: (Value: 1) The event was generated because the sequence file was opened.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.SequenceFileDisplayReasons.SequenceFileDisplayReason_GotoLocation
member.summary: (Value: 3) The event was generated because of a request to display a location that resides in the file.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.SequenceFileDisplayReasons.SequenceFileDisplayReason_NewSequenceFile
member.summary: (Value: 2) The event was generated because a new sequence file was created.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.ExecutionDisplayReasons
member.summary: These constants are passed as a parameter in the ApplicationMgr.DisplayExecution event to provide the reason for why the event was generated.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.ExecutionDisplayReasons.ExecutionDisplayReason_GotoLocation
member.summary: (Value: 5) Event occurred because of a request to display a location that resides in the execution.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.ExecutionDisplayReasons.ExecutionDisplayReason_UIMessage
member.summary: (Value: 0) Event occurred because the TestStand Engine sent the UIMsg_OpenWindows message for the execution.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.ExecutionDisplayReasons.ExecutionDisplayReason_StartExecution
member.summary: (Value: 1) Event occurred because the execution was started.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.ExecutionDisplayReasons.ExecutionDisplayReason_Breakpoint
member.summary: (Value: 2) Event occurred because the execution hit a breakpoint.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.ExecutionDisplayReasons.ExecutionDisplayReason_BreakOnUserRequest
member.summary: (Value: 3) Event occurred because the user paused the execution.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.ExecutionDisplayReasons.ExecutionDisplayReason_BreakOnRunTimeError
member.summary: (Value: 4) Event occurred because the execution was paused as a result of a run-time error.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.TextTypes
member.summary: Use these constants with the ExpressionEdit.TextType property.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.TextTypes.TextType_PlainText
member.summary: (Value: 0) Indicates the text in an ExpressionEdit control is not an expression. The value of the ExpressionEdit.Text property is equivalent to the value of the ExpressionEdit.DisplayText property. This value makes an ExpressionEdit control behave like an edit or text box control. The ExpressionEdit control does not use syntax highlighting, perform error checking, perform autocompletion, or display function tips. The ExpressionEdit control context menu contains only menu items for text editing.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.TextTypes.TextType_Expression
member.summary: (Value: 1) Indicates the text in an ExpressionEdit control is an expression.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.TextTypes.TextType_ExpressionWithCppIdentifiers
member.summary: (Value: 2) Indicates the text in an ExpressionEdit control is an expression that might contain C++ scope resolution and template operators.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.DisplayErrorOptions
member.summary: Use these constants with the ExpressionEdit.DisplayError method.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.DisplayErrorOptions.DisplayError_NoOptions
member.summary: (Value: 0x0) No options.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.DisplayErrorOptions.DisplayError_ForAll
member.summary: (Value: 0x1) Use this option to show or hide the error for all ExpressionEdit controls. This is useful when you modify a PropertyObject used as the context for several ExpressionEdit controls and you want those ExpressionEdit controls to re-evaluate their expressions for errors.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.Borders
member.summary: A Borders object specifies the frame and draggable borders that surround a control. A frame is a thin rectangle that surrounds a control on all sides. A draggable border is a rectangular strip of configurable thickness you can place on any combination of the edges of a control. When the application handles the BorderDragged event for the control, users can drag the borders to resize or move the control. When a control fills a rectangular view area of an application window, you can enable the draggable borders to implement splitter bars that resize the view. Although you can implement splitter bars in some environments without using draggable borders, some environments do not provide any other way to create a splitter bar. For other environments, creating a resizable view using draggable borders is sometimes simpler than using a separate splitter bar. You can also disable the BorderDragged event for a control to use borders for their cosmetic effect only.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.Borders.VisibleBorders
member.summary: Specifies which draggable borders the control displays.
member.remarks: Use any combination of the WhichBorders constants. Use the bitwise-OR operator to specify more than one value.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.Borders.BorderWidth
member.summary: Specifies the width of the draggable borders the control displays.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.Borders.BorderEdgeStyle
member.summary: Specifies the appearance of the draggable borders the control displays.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.Borders.FrameEdgeStyle
member.summary: Specifies the appearance of the frame the control displays.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.Borders.FrameVisible
member.summary: When this property is True, the control displays a thin rectangular frame that surrounds the control.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.Borders.FrameInsideBorders
member.summary: When this property is True, the control displays the frame within the draggable borders. When this property is False, the control displays the frame around the draggable borders.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.Borders.BorderDraggedEventEnabled
member.summary: When this property is True, the control displays a resizing cursor over the draggable borders, and the control generates BorderDragged events when the user drags a draggable border with the mouse.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.Borders.GetFrameThickness(System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Returns the vertical and horizontal thickness of the frame around the control. The values returned are based on the frame visibility and style.
member.param: Returns the thickness, in pixels, of the vertical portion of the frame.
Returns the thickness, in pixels, of the horizontal portion of the frame.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.Borders.FrameEdgeUIStyleColor
member.summary: Specifies the color to use for the frame and draggable borders when using the option EdgeStyles.EdgeStyle_UI. The default color is COLOR_3DFACE.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.EdgeStyles
member.summary: The following constants specify the appearance of the edge of a control or a control element:

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.EdgeStyles.EdgeStyle_Flat
member.summary: (Value: 1) The edge appears flat.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.EdgeStyles.EdgeStyle_FixedSingle
member.summary: (Value: 2) The edge is a black line, one pixel thick.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.EdgeStyles.EdgeStyle_ControlEdge
member.summary: (Value: 3) The edge has the appearance of a control edge. The appearance can vary depending on the Microsoft Windows appearance settings and on the specific property to which you apply this value.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.EdgeStyles.EdgeStyle_Raised
member.summary: (Value: 4) The edge has a raised three-dimensional appearance.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.EdgeStyles.EdgeStyle_Inset
member.summary: (Value: 5) The edge has a sunken three-dimensional appearance.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.EdgeStyles.EdgeStyle_UI
member.summary: (Value: 6) The edge uses the color from the property Borders.FrameEdgeUIStyleColor.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.WhichBorders
member.summary: These constants specify the draggable borders of a control. The control can have borders on any combination of edges or it can have no borders at all. To specify multiple borders, combine these constants with a bitwise-OR operator.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.WhichBorders.WhichBorder_None
member.summary: (Value: 0x0) Specifies no borders.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.WhichBorders.WhichBorder_Top
member.summary: (Value: 0x1) Specifies a border at the top edge of the control.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.WhichBorders.WhichBorder_Bottom
member.summary: (Value: 0x2) Specifies a border at the bottom edge of the control.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.WhichBorders.WhichBorder_Left
member.summary: (Value: 0x4) Specifies a border at the left edge of the control.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.WhichBorders.WhichBorder_Right
member.summary: (Value: 0x8) Specifies a border at the right edge of the control.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.BlockDisplayOptions
member.summary: Use these constants with the SequenceView.BlockDisplayOptions property.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.BlockDisplayOptions.BlockDisplayOption_None
member.summary: (Value: 0x0) No options.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.BlockDisplayOptions.BlockDisplayOption_Indent
member.summary: (Value: 0x1) Indents the steps within a block.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.BlockDisplayOptions.BlockDisplayOption_ShowLines
member.summary: (Value: 0x2) Draws a vertical bar to the left of the steps in a block.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.BlockDisplayOptions.BlockDisplayOption_DottedLines
member.summary: (Value: 0x4) Draws the vertical bar to the left of the block with a dotted line.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.BlockDisplayOptions.BlockDisplayOption_ShowStepIcons
member.summary: (Value: 0x8) Displays icons for steps that define or operate according to the block structure of the sequence.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.BlockDisplayOptions.BlockDisplayOption_BoldStepFont
member.summary: (Value: 0x10) Displays the step name in bold for steps that define or operate according to the block structure of the sequence.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.BlockDisplayOptions.BlockDisplayOption_HighlightMismatchErrors
member.summary: (Value: 0x20) Draws the step name in red for steps that start blocks that do not have an End step and for block ending steps that do not match with a block starting step. Also draws the vertical block bar red for blocks that do not have an ending step.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.BlockDisplayOptions.BlockDisplayOption_ShowGroupLines
member.summary: (Value: 0x40) Draws a vertical bar to the left of the steps in a step group.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.CheckBox
member.summary:
Connect a manager control to a CheckBox control so users can toggle the state of a common user interface command, such as Break on Step Failure. When you connect to a command, the CheckBox control automatically updates the caption text, visibility, and enabled state. When you enable the checkbox, the checkbox executes the command, which toggles the state of the command. The CheckBox control supports the following commands:
* CommandKind_BreakonFirstStep
* CommandKind_BreakonSequenceFailure
* CommandKind_BreakonStepFailure
* CommandKind_ToggleBreakPoint
* CommandKind_TracingEnabled

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.ICheckBox

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.ICheckBox.Caption
member.summary: Specifies the text the control displays.
member.remarks: In the caption, include an ampersand (&) immediately before the character, if any, you want to designate as an accelerator character. The character displays as underlined. Press <Alt> and click the underlined character to move the focus to the control. To include an ampersand character in a caption without creating an accelerator character, include two consecutive ampersands. A single ampersand displays in the caption and no characters display as underlined. When you connect this control to a manager control, the manager control sets this property automatically.

To include an ampersand character in a caption without creating an accelerator character, include two consecutive ampersands. A single ampersand displays in the caption and no characters display as underlined. When you connect this control to a manager control, the manager control sets this property automatically.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.ICheckBox.FontSource
member.summary: Specifies the font the control uses. The default value for this property is FontSource_UseGUIFont.
member.remarks: When the value of this property is FontSource_UseFontProperty, the corresponding Font property specifies the particular font the control uses. Otherwise, the control uses the font from the source this property specifies. Refer to the FontSources enumeration for the list of valid font sources. Set this property to a value other than FontSource_UseFontProperty if you expect the font the CheckBox.Font property specifies to not be present on a computer at run time. For example, a font present on an English version of the Microsoft Windows operating system might not be present on a Japanese version of the Windows operating system.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.CheckBoxClass.FontSource
member.summary: Specifies the font the control uses. The default value for this property is FontSource_UseGUIFont.
member.remarks: When the value of this property is FontSource_UseFontProperty, the corresponding Font property specifies the particular font the control uses. Otherwise, the control uses the font from the source this property specifies. Refer to the FontSources enumeration for the list of valid font sources. Set this property to a value other than FontSource_UseFontProperty if you expect the font the CheckBox.Font property specifies to not be present on a computer at run time. For example, a font present on an English version of the Microsoft Windows operating system might not be present on a Japanese version of the Windows operating system.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.ICheckBox.ScaleWithDPI
member.summary: Specifies how the control scales based on the dots per inch (DPI) setting.
member.remarks:
Some environments scale native controls based on the DPI settings of their display, while other environments do not. The TestStand User Interface Controls are designed to work in all environments. The following are the recommended settings for various platforms:
* LabVIEW, LabWindows/CVI, C#, and Microsoft Visual Basic .NET—Set this property to False.
* Active Template Library (ATL)/Microsoft Foundation Class (MFC)—Set this property to True.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.CheckBoxClass.ScaleWithDPI

* LabVIEW, LabWindows/CVI, C#, and Microsoft Visual Basic .NET—Set this property to False.
* Active Template Library (ATL)/Microsoft Foundation Class (MFC)—Set this property to True.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.ICheckBox.Localize(System.String)
member.summary: Localizes the text caption on the button in this control.
member.remarks:
First, update a .ini file located in the TestStand Language directory with the required string. Second, use the string tag in the .ini file as the caption for the control. When you call this method, the control replaces the caption with the string from the .ini file. If the caption is not a tag in the .ini file, the caption does not change.
Note: When you connect this control to a manager control, the manager control automatically sets a localized caption.
member.param: Specifies the name of the section in the language files that contains the localized text.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.CheckBoxClass.Localize(System.String)
member.summary: Localizes the text caption on the button in this control.
member.remarks:
First, update a .ini file located in the TestStand Language directory with the required string. Second, use the string tag in the .ini file as the caption for the control. When you call this method, the control replaces the caption with the string from the .ini file. If the caption is not a tag in the .ini file, the caption does not change.
Note: When you connect this control to a manager control, the manager control automatically sets a localized caption.
member.param: Specifies the name of the section in the language files that contains the localized text.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.ExpressionEditButton
member.summary: An ExpressionEditButton can be a non-custom button, such as an Expression Browser button, which the ExpressionEdit control manages automatically. An ExpressionEditButton can also be a custom button. You can manage the custom button using the properties of an ExpressionEditButton.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.ExpressionEditButton.Enabled
member.summary: The control responds to user-generated events only when this property is True.
member.remarks: The ExpressionEdit button is disabled when this property is False or the ExpressionEdit.Enabled property is False.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.ExpressionEditButton.hWnd
member.summary: Returns the Window handle of the ExpressionEdit button.
member.remarks:
You can use the returned Window handle with the Microsoft Windows API functions.
Note: Using Windows API functions with this property can cause undefined behavior.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.ExpressionEditButton.Icon
member.summary: Specifies the picture the ExpressionEdit button displays.
member.remarks:
To programmatically add an icon to a custom button, store the icon in the <TestStand Public>\Components\Icons directory and use the following pseudocode to set the image to use:
ExpressionEditButton.Icon = (stdole.IPictureDisp)Engine.Images.FindImage("MyIcon.ico", 16, 16)

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.ExpressionEditButton.Kind
member.summary: Specifies the type of ExpressionEdit button. Use the ExpressionEditButtonKinds constants with this property.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.ExpressionEditButton.ToolTipText
member.summary: Specifies the tooltip for the ExpressionEdit button.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.ExpressionEditButton.ContextMenuItemCaption
member.summary: Set this property to a non-empty string to create a menu item in the ExpressionEdit control context menu for the ExpressionEdit button. Selecting the context menu item is equivalent to clicking the ExpressionEdit button.

remarks.para: Note: The Browse and Check for Errors context menu items do not correspond to the Browse Expression and Check Expression buttons on the ExpressionEdit control. The default ContextMenuItemCaption property for the Browse Expression and Check Expression buttons is empty.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.ExpressionEditButton.ShortcutKey
member.summary: Specifies a keyboard shortcut for clicking the ExpressionEdit button when the ExpressionEdit control is active.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.ExpressionEditButton.ShortcutModifier
member.summary: Specifies modifiers for a keyboard shortcut for clicking the ExpressionEdit button. Use any combination of the ShortcutModifiers constants.

member.summary: Specifies whether the button is visible.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.ExpressionEditButton.BackColor
member.summary: Specifies the background color for the ExpressionEdit button.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.ExpressionEditButton.Style
member.summary: Specifies the appearance of the button.

member.summary: Call this method to simulate a button click.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.ExpressionEditButtons
member.summary: A collection of ExpressionEditButton objects. Use the ExpressionEdit.Buttons property to retrieve the ExpressionEditButtons object for an ExpressionEdit control.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.ExpressionEditButtons.GetItem(System.Int32,NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.SpecifyExpressionEditButton)
member.summary: Returns the ExpressionEdit button at the specified index or of the specified kind.
member.param: When you pass SpecifyButton_ByIndex as the specify parameter, indexOrKind is the zero-based index of the button to return. When you pass SpecifyButton_ByKind, the first button in the collection with a kind of indexOrKind is returned or NULL is returned when no button with a kind of indexOrKind exists.
Specifies whether indexOrKind is a button index or a button kind.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.ExpressionEditButtons.Count
member.summary: Returns the number of items in the collection.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.ExpressionEditButtons.Clear
member.summary: Removes all items from the collection.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.ExpressionEditButtons.Insert(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Adds a new item to the collection.
member.returns: The button added to the collection.
member.param: Specifies the zero-based index where the new button is inserted. Pass -1 to insert the ExpressionEdit button at the end of the collection.
Use the ExpressionEditButtonKinds constants to specify what kind of ExpressionEdit button is created.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.ExpressionEditButtons.Remove(System.Int32,NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.SpecifyExpressionEditButton)
member.summary: Removes the specified item from this collection, if it exists.
member.param: When you pass SpecifyButton_ByIndex as the specify parameter, indexOrKind is the zero-based index of the button to remove from the collection. When you pass SpecifyButton_ByKind, all buttons with a kind of indexOrKind are removed from the collection.
Specifies whether indexOrKind is a button index or a button kind.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.ExpressionEditComboBoxItem
member.summary: An ExpressionEditComboBoxItem is an item that appears in the drop-down list when the ExpressionEdit control is a combo box.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.ExpressionEditComboBoxItem.Icon
member.summary: Specifies the picture that appears in the drop-down list for this item.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.ExpressionEditComboBoxItem.Value
member.summary: Specifies an expression that replaces the text in the ExpressionEdit control when the user selects this item in the drop-down list. The value appears in the drop-down list when the ExpressionEditComboBoxItem.DisplayName property is empty.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.ExpressionEditComboBoxItem.DisplayName
member.summary: When this property is not empty, the display name is shown in the drop-down list instead of the ExpressionEditComboBoxItem.Value property. When you choose this item in the drop-down list, the ExpressionEditComboBoxItem.Value property, not the display name, replaces the existing text. This property is useful for displaying a simple name for a complex expression in the drop-down list.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.ExpressionEditComboBoxItems
member.summary: A collection of ExpressionEditComboBoxItem objects. Use the ExpressionEdit.ComboBoxItems property to retrieve the ExpressionEditComboBoxItems for an ExpressionEdit control.

member.summary: Returns a reference to an item at the specified index in the collection.
member.param: Specifies the zero-based index of the item to return.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.ExpressionEditComboBoxItems.Count
member.summary: Returns the number of items in the collection.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.ExpressionEditComboBoxItems.Clear
member.summary: Removes all items from the drop-down list.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.ExpressionEditComboBoxItems.Insert(System.Int32,System.String,System.String,System.Object@)
member.summary: Adds a new ExpressionEditComboBoxItem in the drop-down list.
member.returns: The item added to the drop-down list.
member.param: Specifies the zero-based index where the new item is inserted. Pass -1 to insert the item at the end of the drop-down list.
Specifies the ExpressionEditComboBoxItem.Value property of the new item. This value appears in the drop-down list when the displayName parameter is empty.

Specifies the ExpressionEditComboBoxItem.DisplayName property of the new item. When this value is not empty, the display name is shown in the drop-down list for the item instead of the val parameter. Display names are useful for displaying a simple name for a complex expression in the drop-down list.

Specifies the ExpressionEditComboBoxItem.Icon property of the new item. This method makes a copy of the picture you pass. You can use the ExpressionEditComboBoxItem.Icon property to either use a picture directly or make a copy of a picture.

member.summary: Removes an item from the drop-down list.
member.param: Specifies the zero-based index of the item to remove from the drop-down list.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.ContentAlignmentStyles
member.summary: Use these constants to specify the alignment of content on the drawing surface.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.ContentAlignmentStyles.ContentAlignmentStyle_MiddleLeft
member.summary: (Value: 0) Content is vertically aligned in the middle and horizontally aligned on the left.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.ContentAlignmentStyles.ContentAlignmentStyle_MiddleRight
member.summary: (Value: 1) Content is vertically aligned in the middle and horizontally aligned on the right.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.ContentAlignmentStyles.ContentAlignmentStyle_MiddleCenter
member.summary: (Value: 2) Content is vertically aligned in the middle and horizontally aligned in the center.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.ContentAlignmentStyles.ContentAlignmentStyle_TopLeft
member.summary: (Value: 3) Content is vertically aligned at the top and horizontally aligned on the left.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.ContentAlignmentStyles.ContentAlignmentStyle_TopRight
member.summary: (Value: 4) Content is vertically aligned at the top and horizontally aligned on the right.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.ContentAlignmentStyles.ContentAlignmentStyle_TopCenter
member.summary: (Value: 5) Content is vertically aligned at the top and horizontally aligned in the center.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.ContentAlignmentStyles.ContentAlignmentStyle_BottomLeft
member.summary: (Value: 6) Content is vertically aligned at the bottom and horizontally aligned on the left.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.ContentAlignmentStyles.ContentAlignmentStyle_BottomCenter
member.summary: (Value: 8) Content is vertically aligned at the bottom and horizontally aligned in the center.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.ContentAlignmentStyles.ContentAlignmentStyle_BottomRight

member.name: E:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI._VariablesViewEvents_Event.BorderDragged
member.summary:
Occurs when you drag a draggable border of a control. This event provides the location and size to which you must set the control for the draggable borders to track the mouse cursor. However, you can choose to modify the location or size to which you set the control. For example, you can limit the width of the control so the left edge of the control cannot be dragged off of the visible portion of the window.
In addition to changing the size and position of the control, you can also update the sizes and positions of the other controls on the window to account for the change.
member.remarks: If you are using LabVIEW, you must add the Horizontal and Vertical components of the origin of the LabVIEW front panel to the newX and newY event parameter values before you can use the newX and newY event parameters to set the ActiveX Container (AxCont) Left and Top properties for the control. To obtain the origin of a LabVIEW front panel, place an ActiveX property node on the block diagram of the VI, right-click the node, and select Link to»Pane from the context menu. Right-click the node again and select Select Property»Origin.
member.param: Specifies which borders you dragged. Refer to the WhichBorders constants for more information about draggable borders.
Specifies the new x-coordinate for the control
Specifies the new y-coordinate for the control.
Specifies the new width for the control.
Specifies the new height for the control.
Specifies whether the event is the final event for the drag operation the user performs.

member.name: E:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI._VariablesViewEvents_Event.ConnectionActivity
member.summary: Occurs after the connection to a manager control makes a change to a user interface control.
member.param: Specifies the type of change.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.IVariablesView.ScaleWithDPI
member.summary: Specifies how the control scales based on the dots per inch (DPI) setting.
member.remarks:
Some environments scale native controls based on the DPI settings of their display, while other environments do not. The TestStand User Interface Controls are designed to work in all environments. National Instruments recommends the following settings for various platforms:
* LabVIEW, LabWindows/CVI, C#, and Microsoft Visual Basic .NET—Set this property to False.
* Active Template Library (ATL)/Microsoft Foundation Class (MFC)—Set this property to True.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.InsertionPalette
member.summary:
Connect a SequenceFileView Manager control to an InsertionPalette control so users can insert steps and template items into a sequence file by dragging or double-clicking.
Select Customize from the context menu of the Step Types list to launch the Step Type Menu Editor dialog box, in which you can customize the structure of the menu.
You can add sequences, steps, or variables to the Templates list by dragging sequences, steps, or variables to the InsertionPalette control from a ListBox, ListBar, SequenceView, or VariablesView control. You can rename, copy, paste, delete, import, and export the items in the Templates list using the context menu, and you can rearrange the items using drag and drop.
You can use one of the following operations to insert a step from the Step Types list or a sequence, step, or variable from the Templates list to a user interface control that displays a list of the corresponding object type:
* Double-click an item in the InsertionPalette control. TestStand inserts the item below the current step, sequence, or variable depending on the type of the item.
* Select an item in the InsertionPalette control and press <Enter>. TestStand inserts the item below the current step, sequence, or variable depending on the type of the item.
* Right-click an item in the InsertionPalette control and select Insert from the context menu. TestStand inserts the item below the current step, sequence, or variable depending on the type of the item.
* Drag an item from the InsertionPalette control and drop the item in the corresponding user interface control that contains a list of the type of items.

member.summary: (Value: 1) Specifies that the Application Manager control never calls the ApplicationMgr.ReloadModifiedSequenceFilesEx method. You must call the ApplicationMgr.ReloadModifiedSequenceFilesEx method to reload modified sequence files.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.AutomaticallyReloadModifiedFilesOptions.AutomaticallyReloadModifiedFilesOption_OnTimer
member.summary: (Value: 2) Specifies that the Application Manager control calls the ApplicationMgr.ReloadModifiedSequenceFilesEx method at the interval you specify with the ApplicationMgr.ReloadModifiedFilesInterval property.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.AutomaticallyReloadModifiedFilesOptions.AutomaticallyReloadModifiedFilesOption_OnActivateApplication
member.summary: (Value: 3) Specifies that the Application Manager control calls the ApplicationMgr.ReloadModifiedSequenceFilesEx method when you activate the application.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.ContextChangedReasons
member.summary: The ExpressionEdit control passes one of these constants as the reason parameter to the ExpressionEdit.ContextChanged event to specify why the ExpressionEdit control generated the ExpressionEdit.ContextChanged event.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.ContextChangedReasons.ContextChangedReason_SetContext
member.summary: (Value: 1) Specifies that the application programmatically set the ExpressionEdit.Context property to a new value.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.ContextChangedReasons.ContextChangedReason_VariableCreatedFromContextMenu
member.summary: (Value: 2) Specifies that the user modified the context the ExpressionEdit.Context property specifies when creating a variable through the context menu in the ExpressionEdit control.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.ContextChangedReasons.ContextChangedReason_ExpressionBrowserDialogBox
member.summary: (Value: 3) Specifies that the user modified the context the ExpressionEdit.Context property specifies through the context menu in the Expression Browser dialog box. A user can rename, insert, or delete properties. This constant is not set when the user modifies only the value of a variable or property.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.ConnectionActivityTypes
member.summary: This data type contains values that specify the type of change or refresh the connection to a manager control makes to a user interface control. Use these values with a ConnectionActivity event.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.ConnectionActivityTypes.ConnectionActivityType_TextChange
member.summary: (Value: 1) The connection changed or refreshed the text of the control.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.ConnectionActivityTypes.ConnectionActivityType_NumberChange
member.summary: (Value: 2) The connection changed or refreshed the numerical value of the control.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.ConnectionActivityTypes.ConnectionActivityType_BooleanChange
member.summary: (Value: 3) The connection changed or refreshed the Boolean value of the control.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.ConnectionActivityTypes.ConnectionActivityType_ImageChange
member.summary: (Value: 4) The connection changed or refreshed an image the control displays.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.ConnectionActivityTypes.ConnectionActivityType_ContentChange
member.summary: (Value: 5) The connection changed or refreshed the contents of the control, such as the available items in a Listbox, Combobox, ReportView, or ListBarPage.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.ConnectionActivityTypes.ConnectionActivityType_CursorOrSelectionChange
member.summary: (Value: 6) The connection changed or refreshed the cursor or selection in the control.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.ConnectionActivityTypes.ConnectionActivityType_EnabledChange
member.summary: (Value: 7) The connection changed or refreshed the enabled state of the control.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.ConnectionActivityTypes.ConnectionActivityType_VisibleChange
member.summary: (Value: 8) The connection changed or refreshed the visibility of the control.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.EditingDenialReasons
member.summary: This data type contains values that indicate reasons why an editing action cannot take place. Use these constants with the ApplicationMgr.BeginEdit and ApplicationMgr.CanEdit events.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.EditingDenialReasons.EditingDenialReason_IsReadOnly
member.summary: (Value: 0x1) Editing is blocked because the file to edit is read-only.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.EditingDenialReasons.EditingDenialReason_IsNotEditor
member.summary: (Value: 0x2) Editing is blocked because the value of the ApplicationMgr.IsEditor property is False.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.EditingDenialReasons.EditingDenialReason_IsExecuting
member.summary: (Value: 0x4) Editing is blocked because the file to edit is executing.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.EditingDenialReasons.EditingDenialReason_IsLocked
member.summary: (Value: 0x8) Editing is blocked because the file to edit is locked.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.EditingDenialReasons.EditingDenialReason_NoFileEditingPrivilege
member.summary: (Value: 0x10) Editing is blocked because the current user does not have privileges to edit the file.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.EditingFlags.EditingFlag_Rename

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.EditingFlags.EditingFlag_Copy

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.ButtonStyles
member.summary: Use these constants with the Button.Style property to specify the appearance of the button and how the button operates.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.ButtonStyles.ButtonStyle_Standard
member.summary: (Value: 1) The button displays a three-dimensional border.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.ButtonStyles.ButtonStyle_ToolBar
member.summary: (Value: 2) You cannot tab to the button. When the application supports Microsoft Windows XP themes, the button displays a border only when you hover over it.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.TextImageRelations
member.summary: Use these constants with Button.TextImageRelation to specify how to display the image in relation to the text.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.TextImageRelations.TextImageRelation_Overlay
member.summary: (Value: 0) Displays the image behind the text.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.TextImageRelations.TextImageRelation_ImageBelowText
member.summary: (Value: 1) Displays the image below the text.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.TextImageRelations.TextImageRelation_ImageAboveText
member.summary: (Value: 2) Displays the image above the text.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.TextImageRelations.TextImageRelation_ImageBeforeText
member.summary: (Value: 3) Displays the image to the left of the text.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.TextImageRelations.TextImageRelation_ImageAfterText
member.summary: (Value: 4) Displays the image to the right of the text.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.ButtonActionStyles
member.summary: Use these constants with Button.ActionStyle to specify how the button behaves when you click it.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.ButtonActionStyles.ButtonActionStyle_PushButton
member.summary: (Value: 0) Specifies that the button changes to a pressed state only when you click it.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.ButtonActionStyles.ButtonActionStyle_ToggleButton
member.summary: (Value: 1) Specifies that the button changes to a pressed state when you set the Button.Value property to True and changes to a normal state when you set the value to False.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.ListBoxColumn
member.summary: The ListBoxColumn object represents a visible column in the ListBox control. Use the ListBox.ColumnSet property to obtain a list of columns for the control. When using a SequenceListConnection, use the SequenceListConnection.GetColumnIndex and SequenceListConnection.SetColumnVisible methods to determine the columns the ListBox control displays and the index for each column in ListBoxColumns.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.ListBoxColumn.Index
member.summary: Returns the zero-based numeric index of the column within the ListBoxColumns collection.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.ListBoxColumn.Width
member.summary: Specifies the width of the column in pixels.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.ListBoxColumn.AutoSizing
member.summary: Specifies whether the column automatically grows or shrinks to adjust to changes in the size of the control. This property does not take effect unless the ListBox.AutoSizeColumns property is True.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.ListBoxColumn.Caption
member.summary: Returns the caption in the header for the column.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.ListBoxColumns
member.summary: A collection of ListBoxColumn objects. Use the ListBox.ColumnSet property to obtain a collection of columns for a ListBox control.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.ListBoxColumns.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a reference to an item at the specified index in the collection.
member.param: Pass the zero-based index of the column to return.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.ListBoxColumns.Count
member.summary: Returns the number of items in the collection.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.AutoSizingOptions
member.summary: Use these constants with the SeqViewColumn.Autosizing and ListBoxColumn.Autosizing properties.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.AutoSizingOptions.AutoSizingOption_None
member.summary: (Value: 0) The item does not automatically resize itself.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.AutoSizingOptions.AutoSizingOption_Proportional
member.summary: (Value: 1) The item resizes when the container resizes. The item determines the amount to resize from the proportion that the current size occupies of the total size of all resizable items in the same container.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.ProcessCommandLineErrors
member.summary: Use these constants in the ApplicationMgr.ProcessUserCommandLineArguments event to specify an error that occurs while processing the command line.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.ProcessCommandLineErrors.ProcessCommandLineError_None
member.summary: (Value: 0) Specifies that no error occurred while processing the command line.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.ProcessCommandLineErrors.ProcessCommandLineError_UnrecognizedArgumentError
member.summary: (Value: 1) Specifies that you encountered an unrecognized command-line argument while processing the command line.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.ProcessCommandLineErrors.ProcessCommandLineError_CustomError
member.summary: (Value: 2) Specifies that an error you define occurred while processing the command line.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.InsertionPalettePage
member.summary: Use an InsertionPalettePage object to control whether a page is expanded or visible on an InsertionPalette control.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.InsertionPalettePage.Index
member.summary: Returns the zero-based index of the page on the InsertionPalette.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.InsertionPalettePage.Visible
member.summary: Specifies whether the page is visible.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.InsertionPalettePage.SplitterRatio
member.summary:
Specifies the percentage of the InsertionPalette the page uses. Changes to this property affect this property for other pages.
Note: This property is valid only when pages exist after the current page. In all other cases, this property is ignored.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.InsertionPalettePage.Expanded
member.summary: Specifies whether the content of the page is expanded to show the list.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.InsertionPalettePages
member.summary: A collection of InsertionPalettePage objects. Use the InsertionPalette.Pages property to retrieve the InsertionPalettePages object for an InsertionPalette. Use the InsertionPalettePage.Visible property to control whether the page is visible.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.InsertionPalettePages.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a reference to an item at the specified index in the collection.
member.param: Specifies the zero-based index of the item.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.InsertionPalettePages.Count
member.summary: Returns the number of items in the collection.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.ReloadFileOptions
member.summary: Use these constants with the ApplicationMgr.ReloadFile method.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.ReloadFileOptions.ReloadFileOption_OnlyIfModifiedOnDisk
member.summary: (Value 0x1) Use this option when you want to make reloading occur conditionally based on whether the file has been modified on disk since the user was last prompted to reload it. You can combine this option with ReloadFileOption_OnlyIfModifiedInMemory.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.ReloadFileOptions.ReloadFileOption_OnlyIfModifiedInMemory
member.summary: (Value 0x2) Use this option when you want to make reloading occur conditionally based on whether the file is modified in memory. You can combine this option with ReloadFileOption_OnlyIfModifiedOnDisk.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.TestStand.Interop.UI.ReloadFileOptions.ReloadFileOption_NoOptions
member.summary: (Value 0x0) No options.
